Class SmartTargetingEnemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObject
      • MoveableEntity
        • Enemy
          • SmartTargetingEnemy

    public class SmartTargetingEnemy
extends Enemy
    This creates enemies that follow a certain wall. Version History - version 1.0, version 1.1, version 1.2, version 2.0 Filename: SmartTargetingEnemy.java
    Since:
    19-11-2019 copyright: No Copyright Purpose
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Ben Parker

    • Constructor Detail

      • SmartTargetingEnemy

        public SmartTargetingEnemy()
        The default constructor - only used for creating nodes.

      • SmartTargetingEnemy

        public SmartTargetingEnemy(int[] playerLoc)
        The constructor for creating smart targeting enemies. This creates a node for both the enemy and the player.
        Parameters:
        playerLoc - - the current location of the player

    • Method Detail

      • nextMove

        public void nextMove(int[] playerLoc)
        Moves the enemy in a direction such that they're heading towards the player. If there's no path to the player, they will head in a random direction
        Specified by:
        nextMove in class Enemy
        Parameters:
        playerLoc - - the current location of the player

      • startTargeting

        public void startTargeting(int[] playerLoc)
        This is called when the enemy has all required data, and starts the targetting algorithm
        Parameters:
        playerLoc - - the current coordinates of the player

      • toString

        Returns the string of the smart targeting enemy.

      • distanceToNode

        protected int distanceToNode(PositionNode startNode,
                             PositionNode endNode)
        Gets the distance of the path between two nodes.
        Parameters:
        startNode - - the node at the beginning of the path
        endNode - - the node at the end of the path
        Returns:
        - the positive result of the sum of the difference in x and y
